article: I stepped into my hotel room which was surrounded by a(n) _ king-size bed, flanked by overstuffed armchairs. "Wow," I thought to myself. "Nice place." I _ hotels. I love to enter a clean room, look out the window, or walk out in the morning _ that each afternoon when I return, someone else will have made the bed. The _ is that unless Alison travels with me, I never sleep well in hotels. I miss my family. Even though Linus and Camille, aged 4 and almost 2, find a way to interrupt even the _ night's sleep at home, still, I'd rather be with them. I'm deeply _ by the parents who wake up too late with the realization: "My children grew up too _ . In the busy and noisy career and life, I _ their childhood." A hundred years from now, nobody will remember the car you drove or the large house you lived. The world might _ greatly however, based on your _ on the life of a small child. Your life will most certainly improve, if you pay attention to your important _ , and make the choice to put her or him first. What could you do today to let your loved ones know how much they _ to you? What will you do tomorrow? And the next day? Think of one specific _ that you can take, and take it. Challenge yourself to find new ways to _ your appreciation and love on a daily basis. Room service will never kiss you goodnight! Nothing _ family.
